alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued March 02 at 3:47PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding possible. * WHERE...Monroe County. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East to northeast gales of around 35 knots with gusts possibly to 40 knots at times and waves of 6 to 8 feet are anticipated in the western basin of Lake Erie Friday afternoon and evening. As a result, water levels at Toledo may rise above 72 inches above low water datum late Friday afternoon into Friday evening. For Monroe County, the greatest water level rises and chance for lakeshore flooding will be in the southeastern portion of the county.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
